com.vaadin.polymer.vaadin.widget

Class VaadinGrid

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.UIObject
      • com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget
        • com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Panel
          • com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.ComplexPanel
            • com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.HTMLPanel
              • com.vaadin.polymer.PolymerWidget
                • com.vaadin.polymer.vaadin.widget.VaadinGrid
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.google.gwt.event.logical.shared.HasAttachHandlers, com.google.gwt.event.shared.HasHandlers, com.google.gwt.user.client.EventListener, com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.HasVisibility, com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.HasWidgets, com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.HasWidgets.ForIsWidget, com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.IndexedPanel, com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.IndexedPanel.ForIsWidget, com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.IsWidget, Iterable<com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget>

    public class VaadinGrid
extends PolymerWidget

    Data grid for showing large amountsos of tabular data.

    Basic usage:

    <vaadin-grid>
   <table>
     <colgroup>
       <col header-text="Name">
       <col header-text="Value">
       <col header-text="Progress">
     </colgroup>
     <tbody>
       <tr>
         <td>Project A</td><td>10000</td><td>0.8</td>
       </tr>
       <tr>
         <td>Project B</td><td>999999</td><td>0.8</td>
       </tr>
     </tbody>
   </table>
 </vaadin-grid>

    More examples available at https://cdn.vaadin.com/vaadin-elements/latest/vaadin-grid/demo/

      • getFrozenColumns

        public double getFrozenColumns()

        The number of frozen columns in this grid. Setting it to 0
        means that no data columns will be frozen, but the built-in selection
        checkbox column will still be frozen if it’s in use. Setting the count to
        -1 will also disable the selection column.

        Attribute: frozen-columns

        JavaScript Info:

      • setFrozenColumns

        public void setFrozenColumns(double value)

        The number of frozen columns in this grid. Setting it to 0
        means that no data columns will be frozen, but the built-in selection
        checkbox column will still be frozen if it’s in use. Setting the count to
        -1 will also disable the selection column.

        Attribute: frozen-columns

        JavaScript Info:

      • getVisibleRows

        public double getVisibleRows()

        The number of visible rows in the grid. Implicitly sets the height
        in the inline style, overriding any previous height. Setting style.height
        in this case should be ignored if possible.

        Attribute: visible-rows

        JavaScript Info:

      • getItems

        public Object getItems()

        An array or a function containing or returning items determining
        rows in the grid.

        Examples:

         grid.items = [
      ["horse", 150, "domestic"],
      ["wolf", 100, "wild"]
  ];
 
         grid.items = function(params, callback) {
    callback(['foo', 'bar'], 2);
  };
        JavaScript Info:

      • getRowDetailsGenerator

        public Function getRowDetailsGenerator()

        The row detail generator that is used for generating detail content for rows.

        Example:

        grid.rowDetails.detailsGenerator = function(rowIndex) {
  var detail = document.createElement('div');
  detail.textContent = 'Row detail content for row ' + rowIndex;
  return detail;
 };
        JavaScript Info:

        JavaScript Info:

      • getCellClassGenerator

        public Function getCellClassGenerator()

        The style generator that is used for generating styles for cells.

        Example:

        grid.cellClassGenerator = function(cell) {
   if (cell.index == 2) {
      var activity = cell.row.data[2];
      return 'activity-' + activity.toLowerCase();
    }
    return '';
  };
        JavaScript Info:

      • setCellClassGenerator

        public void setCellClassGenerator(Function value)

        The style generator that is used for generating styles for cells.

        Example:

        grid.cellClassGenerator = function(cell) {
   if (cell.index == 2) {
      var activity = cell.row.data[2];
      return 'activity-' + activity.toLowerCase();
    }
    return '';
  };
        JavaScript Info:

      • addColumn

        public void addColumn(Column column,
                      String beforeColumn)

        Adds a new column. Column is added at the end if beforeColumn is not defined.

        JavaScript Info:
        Parameters:
        {Column} - column
        {string} - beforeColumn

      • scrollToEnd

        public VaadinGridElement scrollToEnd()

        Scrolls to the end of the grid.

        Scrolling happens asynchronously, so this method returns a ‘thenable’
        which can be used to be notified when the scrolling is finished.

        Example: grid.scrollToEnd().then(doMoreStuff);

        JavaScript Info:
        Returns:
        {VaadinGridElement}

      • scrollToStart

        public VaadinGridElement scrollToStart()

        Scrolls to the beginning of the grid.

        Scrolling happens asynchronously, so this method returns a ‘thenable’
        which can be used to be notified when the scrolling is finished.

        Example: grid.scrollToStart().then(doMoreStuff);

        JavaScript Info:
        Returns:
        {VaadinGridElement}

        Returns:

      • scrollToRow

        public VaadinGridElement scrollToRow(double index,
                                     String scrollDestination)

        Scrolls to a certain row, using user-specified scroll destination.

        Scrolling happens asynchronously, so this method returns a ‘thenable’
        which can be used to be notified when the scrolling is finished.

        Example: grid.scrollToRow(10, 'end').then(doMoreStuff);

        JavaScript Info:
        Parameters:
        {number} - index
        {string} - scrollDestination
        Returns:
        {VaadinGridElement}

        JavaScript Info:

        {boolean} - visible

      • getItem

        public void getItem(double rowIndex,
                    Function callback,
                    boolean onlyCached)

        Invokes the callback with row data of the provided row index as the
        parameter. If the row is not cached, it’s fetched from the data source
        first.

        JavaScript Info:
        Parameters:
        {number} - rowIndex
        {Function} - callback
        {boolean} - onlyCached
